intro: Geonoma meridionalis, commonly known as the southern geonoma, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants, although this species is actually a fern, not a flowering plant. The plant is characterized by its dense, rosette-like arrangement of narrow, leathery leaves that form a compact structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories where it can absorb humidity and indirect light. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
